title: Projects & IAM
description: Manage projects, permissions, and service accounts

cards.task: List all projects you have access to
cards.description: Shows all Google Cloud projects accessible with your current credentials.
cards.whenToUse: When finding project IDs or reviewing available projects.
scenarios: Project discovery: Finding the project ID you need
Access audit: Reviewing which projects you can access
Account overview: Listing all projects under your account

cards.task: Display metadata for a specific project
cards.description: Shows detailed information about a project including its name, number, and labels.
cards.whenToUse: When you need project details like the project number or creation date.
scenarios: Project info: Getting the project number for API calls
Verification: Confirming project details before making changes
Documentation: Recording project metadata for reference

cards.task: Create a new Google Cloud project
cards.description: Creates a new Google Cloud project with the specified ID.
cards.whenToUse: When starting a new application or setting up separate environments.
scenarios: New application: Creating a project for a new app
Environment setup: Creating staging/production projects
Isolation: Creating separate projects for different workloads

cards.description: Creates a service account for automated access to Google Cloud services.
cards.whenToUse: When setting up automated processes or CI/CD pipelines.
scenarios: CI/CD: Creating an account for deployment pipelines
Automation: Setting up accounts for scheduled scripts
Server access: Creating accounts for server-to-server auth

cards.task: List all service accounts in a project
cards.description: Shows all service accounts created in the current project.
cards.whenToUse: When auditing service accounts or finding account emails.
scenarios: Audit: Reviewing all service accounts for security
Discovery: Finding the email of a service account
Cleanup: Identifying unused service accounts

cards.task: Create and download a service account key
cards.answer: gcloud iam service-accounts keys create key.json --iam-account=<email>
cards.description: Generates a JSON key file for a service account that can be used for authentication.
cards.whenToUse: When setting up service account authentication for applications.
scenarios: App authentication: Creating keys for backend services
CI/CD setup: Generating keys for deployment scripts
Local development: Creating keys for testing locally

cards.task: Grant a role to a user or service account
cards.description: Adds an IAM role binding to grant permissions to a user or service account.
cards.whenToUse: When granting access to team members or service accounts.
scenarios: Team access: Granting a developer access to a project
Service permissions: Giving a service account specific roles
Elevated access: Granting admin roles for maintenance

cards.task: List all IAM roles available for a resource
cards.description: Shows all IAM roles that can be assigned for a specific resource.
cards.whenToUse: When finding the right role to assign for a task.
scenarios: Role discovery: Finding what roles are available
Permission planning: Reviewing roles before granting access
Least privilege: Finding the most restrictive suitable role

cards.task: View the IAM policy for a project
cards.description: Displays all IAM bindings showing who has what access to the project.
cards.whenToUse: When auditing access or troubleshooting permission issues.
scenarios: Security audit: Reviewing who has access to a project
Troubleshooting: Checking why someone can't access resources
Compliance: Documenting access controls for auditors
